title: Proton Beams
description: Investigating how proton beams form, evolve, and interact with the solar wind to uncover the mechanisms generating them.

title: Helium Abundance
description: Characterizing how helium abundance varies across solar wind conditions and solar cycles to trace the sources, acceleration, and heating of the wind.

title: Space Weather
description: Developing in situ diagnostics to connect solar wind structure and variability to solar sources and their role in shaping space weather at Earth.

title: Suprathermal Ions
description: Studying quiet-time suprathermal ion populations to reveal their origins, spectral properties, and links to solar energetic particle acceleration.

title: Heavy Ion Composition
description: Analyzing heavy ion abundance patterns to map solar wind source regions and identify fractionation processes in different wind regimes.

title: Coulomb Collisions
description: Quantifying the role of Coulomb collisions in regulating ion differential flows and distribution, with implications for plasma heating and transport.

title: Kinetic Physics
description: Exploring particle-scale dynamics in the solar wind to understand how kinetic processes shape ion behavior beyond fluid approximations.
